page.title: 15Life In St.Leonard's, 1985
page.content: The family unit of married couple with children living together is still common.An average family has 1 or 2 children.Family size is often limited by contraception.Most homes have at least one colour television.About a third have a video recorder/player. Watching television is the main leisure occupation.Listening to radio, records or cassette tapes is also popular.Home computers are increasing. Relatively few now make their own home entertainment.The affluent often eat at restaurants.Takeaway restaurants abound.Most families have at least one car.Driving for pleasure is common, though petrol,at Â£2 a gallon,is dear. Going to pubs,ancient monuments,sport, beaches,friends' or relatives' houses, as well as on the annual fortnight's holiday and daily home to work travel make up most of the mileage.
